citations.narrative:
- At the start of the inspection (just before noon) the temperature inside the sheltered kennel building registered at 90.1 F.
The temperature was rechecked 4 hours after the initial reading and was recorded at 92.3 F. Excessive heat is a source
of stress and discomfort to the enclosed dogs and can result in a variety of health impacts if not corrected. The
temperature in the interior portion of a sheltered kennel must not rise above 85F for more than four consecutive hours.
The licensee must ensure that interior temperatures are maintained at a safe level for the dogs.
Correct by: 18 July 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Kristina Plank, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
3.3(a) 
   
Sheltered housing facilities. 
- At the start of the inspection (just before noon) the temperature inside the sheltered kennel building registered at 90.1 F. 
The temperature was rechecked 4 hours after the initial reading and was recorded at 92.3 F. Excessive heat is a source 
of stress and discomfort to the enclosed dogs and can result in a variety of health impacts if not corrected. The 
temperature in the interior portion of a sheltered kennel must not rise above 85F for more than four consecutive hours. 
The licensee must ensure that interior temperatures are maintained at a safe level for the dogs. 
Correct by: 18 July 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Kristina Plank, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
